intro: Centaurium quitense, commonly known as the Andean centaury, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It is a member of the Gentianaceae family, characterized by its showy, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and rocky slopes, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its flowering period occurs during the spring and early summer months. The plant has small, narrow leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind.
